header_summary: The context discusses the impact of a policy change on full node operators and the use of OP_RETURN. It also explores the prunability of OP_RETURN outputs and its potential impact on new nodes. Additionally, it mentions a proposal for a `keysend` protocol and the availability of Lightning specification meeting transcripts.

recent_posts.title: Pull-req to remove the arbitrary limits on OP_Return outputs
recent_posts.summary:
- The first question asks how the policy change affects full node operators and data storage.
- The second question discusses the possibility of pruning OP_RETURN outputs and its impact.
- The individual seeks clarification on the overall impact of the policy change and pruning on full node operators and new nodes.

recent_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
recent_posts.summary:
- The link provided leads to a comment on Merkle.fun labeled as "WIP" mentioning OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY.
- The comment may not be the "complete proposal" as it does not mention multiple core opcodes.
- You were expecting a draft BIP and are uncertain if the WIP comment is comprehensive.

recent_posts.title: BIP-352 Silent Payments addresses should have an expiration time
recent_posts.summary:
- The feedback acknowledges that the raised issue is not limited to BIP352 but Bitcoin overall.
- To implement expiration dates effectively, a separate BIP should be proposed and discussed.
- Expiration dates may weaken the value of silent payments and compromise privacy and safety.

recent_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
recent_posts.summary:
- Carla and Clara agree with Elias on privacy and propose a six-month data collection period.
- They plan to establish a common data format to eliminate the need for data exportation.
- Carla and Clara assure Elias that they will handle sensitive information responsibly and fuzz timestamps.

recent_posts.title: Multipath Keysend
recent_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj proposed a scheme for multipath payments in the Lightning-dev mailing list.
- The scheme involves embedding a preimage in the `keysend` and generating a payment hash.
- This enables the receiver to claim the payment only after receiving all parts.

recent_posts.title: Specification Meeting Transcripts
recent_posts.summary:
- Our team has been diligently recording and transcribing specification meetings since the beginning of the year.
- The transcripts are now available to everyone at [https://btctranscripts.com/lightning-specification].
- Gurwinder at Chaincode has reviewed and ensured the accuracy of these high-quality recordings.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- The context discusses the implementation of a blinded statechains protocol using 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2.
- In this protocol, party 1 is blinded and does not learn certain information.
- Party 2 performs key and nonce aggregation, while party 1 remains blind and does not learn the final signature or message.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- Ark is a new second-layer protocol design that provides an alternative to Lightning network.
- It uses virtual UTXOs (vTXOs) and does not require opening and closing channels.
- Ark's anonymous, off-chain payments are facilitated through an untrusted intermediary called the Ark Service Provider (ASP).

active_posts.title: Pull-req to enable Full-RBF by default
active_posts.summary:
- The author has proposed enabling full-replace-by-fee (full-rbf) by default in Bitcoin Core.
- Various block explorers, nodes, and wallets already support and enable full-rbf functionality.
- The author suggests deprecating and removing all BIP125 code in future Bitcoin Core releases.

active_posts.title: Potential vulnerability in Lightning backends: BOLT-11 "payment hash" does not commit to payment!
active_posts.summary:
- The LNbits team patched an exploit in version 0.10.5 that allowed attackers to create balances.
- The attack involved creating a malicious invoice that appeared to be equal to another.
- Developers are encouraged to refer to the "payment hash" field as the "preimage hash" to avoid assumptions.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2023 Notes
active_posts.summary:
- The annual specification meeting took place in late June in New York City.
- Attendees experimented with transcript-style notes, accessible through a provided link.
- The notes aim to capture summit discussions and gratitude was expressed to participants and hosts.

active_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
active_posts.summary:
- Blinded paths in the Lightning Network provide privacy for receiving nodes among anonymous users.
- Payments can only be made through given paths, potentially favoring compliant nodes.
- There are concerns about decreased decentralization and compromised sender-side privacy.
